The Secwepemc Museum and Heritage Park is an indoor and outdoor museum with the purpose of preserving and promoting the cultural heritage of the Secw√©pemc people, located in Kamloops, British Columbia.
Displays
The inside of the museum has four different galleries showcasing the cultural and traditional lives of the Secwepemc people.
The Heritage Park consists of a trail along the South Thompson River which allows visitors to explore a 2000-year-old pithouse and an ethnobotanical garden which is filled with traditional Secwepemc plants.
Affiliations
The Museum is affiliated with: CMA,  CHIN, and Virtual Museum of Canada.
